Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Associate Manager in Data Science to lead our team based in Bangalore. As an Associate Manager, you will play a critical role in driving the success of our Data Science projects, leading a team of data scientists, and delivering business needs. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, and a solid background in leading teams, interacting with business stakeholders, and delivering production-grade AI/ML projects. Candidate should have solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts and well-versed with bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML. Experience in the US Healthcare domain, knowledge of Big Data and data streaming technologies are is desirable.
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead a team of data scientists, providing mentorship, guidance, and technical expertise
Interact with business stakeholders to understand their AI/ML requirements and translate them into actionable projects
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project goals, scope, and deliverables
Utilize your expertise in Python, pandas, numpy, and SQL to develop AI/ML solutions
Apply frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch to build and deploy models
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), statistical analysis, and feature engineering to derive insights
Build, tune, and evaluate machine learning models for predictive and prescriptive analytics
Perform drift analysis and ensure the responsible use of AI/ML by considering bias and fairness testing
Oversee the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including data preparation, model development, tuning, and deployment
Ensure the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of AI/ML solutions in production environments
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML techniques and tools, and identify opportunities to apply them to enhance existing solutions
Document and communicate findings, methodologies, and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field
4+ years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, or a similar role
Experience in leading a team of data scientists
Hands-on experience in delivering production-grade AI/ML projects
Knowledge of the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including EDA, model development, tuning, and drift analysis
In-depth understanding & extensive experiencing with Transformers, RAG, Vector DB and Large Language Models
Understanding of bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML
Proficiency in frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch
Solid programming skills in Python, with experience in pandas, numpy, and SQL
Solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts
Proven excellent leadership, problem-solving, and analytical thinking skills
Proven solid communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with business stakeholders and cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Big Data technologies (PySpark, Hadoop) and data streaming tools (Kafka, etc.)
Familiarity with the US Healthcare domain

Job Title: Lead Data Scientist, India - BCG X

Locations: Mumbai | Gurgaon
Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, exceptional collaborative spirit, excellent leadership and communication skills, a detail-oriented and can-do mindset, and robust understanding of business matters.







Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

OptumAI is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with deep subject matter expertise in text processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will be part of a team leading the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business.
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.
Primary Responsibilities:
Help design and develop the next generation of NLP, ML & AI products, and services for healthcare
Develop machine learning and deep learning models and systems in domains including, but not limited to: NLP, NLU, NLG, SLU and multidimensional time series forecasting among others
Ability to Quantize, Optimize GenAI models
Manage NLP & ML models lifecycle for a suite of products
Run large complex proof-of-concepts for the healthcare business
Manage prioritization and technology work for building NLP, ML & AI solutions
Lead the full end-to-end machine learning development process including data ingestion and preparation, feature engineering, analysis and modeling, model deployment, performance tracking and documentation
Establish best practices for end-to-end deep learning and machine learning development cycle to ensure rigor in process and quality in outcome
Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems

The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so
Required Qualifications:
Master’s in computer science, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or another quantitative field
7+ years of industry/academic experience in data science, machine learning or a related field
5+ years of experience with Machine Learning and Deep Learning modeling
3+ years of experience with Deep Learning Frameworks and Distributed training
2+ years of experience applying computational algorithms and statistical methods to both structured and unstructured data.
1+ years of experience in GenAI models
Exposure in RAG, LangChain, VectorDBs
Proven excellent communication, writing and presentation skills

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. Job Title: Lead Data Scientist, India - BCG X
Job Description:
Locations: Mumbai | Gurgaon
Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, exceptional collaborative spirit, excellent leadership and communication skills, a detail-oriented and can-do mindset, and robust understanding of business matters.







Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

OptumAI is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with deep subject matter expertise in text processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will be part of a team leading the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business.
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.
Primary Responsibilities:
Help design and develop the next generation of NLP, ML & AI products, and services for healthcare
Develop machine learning and deep learning models and systems in domains including, but not limited to: NLP, NLU, NLG, SLU and multidimensional time series forecasting among others
Ability to Quantize, Optimize GenAI models
Manage NLP & ML models lifecycle for a suite of products
Run large complex proof-of-concepts for the healthcare business
Manage prioritization and technology work for building NLP, ML & AI solutions
Lead the full end-to-end machine learning development process including data ingestion and preparation, feature engineering, analysis and modeling, model deployment, performance tracking and documentation
Establish best practices for end-to-end deep learning and machine learning development cycle to ensure rigor in process and quality in outcome
Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems
Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so
Required Qualifications:
Master’s in computer science, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or another quantitative field
7+ years of industry/academic experience in data science, machine learning or a related field
5+ years of experience with Machine Learning and Deep Learning modeling
3+ years of experience with Deep Learning Frameworks and Distributed training
2+ years of experience applying computational algorithms and statistical methods to both structured and unstructured data.
1+ years of experience in GenAI models
Exposure in RAG, LangChain, VectorDBs
Proven excellent communication, writing and presentation skills

Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, exceptional collaborative spirit, excellent leadership and communication skills, a detail-oriented and can-do mindset, and robust understanding of business matters.







Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

OptumAI is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with deep subject matter expertise in text processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will be part of a team leading the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business.
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.

Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems

WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

OptumAI is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with deep subject matter expertise in text processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will be part of a team leading the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business.
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

OptumAI is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with deep subject matter expertise in text processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will be part of a team leading the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business.
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.

Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems

WHAT YOU'LL DO

You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.

Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, exceptional collaborative spirit, excellent leadership and communication skills, a detail-oriented and can-do mindset, and robust understanding of business matters.







Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

OptumAI is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with deep subject matter expertise in text processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will be part of a team leading the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business.
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.

Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems

Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, exceptional collaborative spirit, excellent leadership and communication skills, a detail-oriented and can-do mindset, and robust understanding of business matters.







Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, exceptional collaborative spirit, excellent leadership and communication skills, a detail-oriented and can-do mindset, and robust understanding of business matters.







Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.

MacroCosmos Creations is a team of experts in diverse fields, committed to using scientific research and innovation to develop sustainable solutions for environmental sustainability, food systems, and health & wellness. Our team brings together experts from similar and diverse fields, including and not limited to forest ecology, biophysics, precision agriculture, and sustainable food and agri solutions to develop products and solutions that make a positive impact on the planet. Our values include ethical business practices, transparency, diversity, and inclusion, and we strive to ensure that our customers and partners understand the purpose and benefits of each of our products, designed to support a better future for all. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our team and contribute to our vision of creating a sustainable future for all.

About the Role:
We are looking for a Data Scientist that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data,
and help us make smarter decisions that brings in good business value.
Your primary focus will be in applying Data Mining techniques, doing Statistical Analysis, building Statistical /
ML models and support Analytic Implementations in production systems / processes.
Responsibilities:
Collect and analyze large sets of structured and unstructured data
Develop predictive models and algorithms to support business decisions - Selecting/engineering features,

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Associate Manager in Data Science to lead our team based in Bangalore. As an Associate Manager, you will play a critical role in driving the success of our Data Science projects, leading a team of data scientists, and delivering business needs. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, and a solid background in leading teams, interacting with business stakeholders, and delivering production-grade AI/ML projects. Candidate should have solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts and well-versed with bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML. Experience in the US Healthcare domain, knowledge of Big Data and data streaming technologies are is desirable.
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead a team of data scientists, providing mentorship, guidance, and technical expertise
Interact with business stakeholders to understand their AI/ML requirements and translate them into actionable projects
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project goals, scope, and deliverables
Utilize your expertise in Python, pandas, numpy, and SQL to develop AI/ML solutions
Apply frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch to build and deploy models
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), statistical analysis, and feature engineering to derive insights
Build, tune, and evaluate machine learning models for predictive and prescriptive analytics
Perform drift analysis and ensure the responsible use of AI/ML by considering bias and fairness testing
Oversee the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including data preparation, model development, tuning, and deployment
Ensure the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of AI/ML solutions in production environments
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML techniques and tools, and identify opportunities to apply them to enhance existing solutions
Document and communicate findings, methodologies, and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field
4+ years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, or a similar role
Experience in leading a team of data scientists
Hands-on experience in delivering production-grade AI/ML projects
Knowledge of the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including EDA, model development, tuning, and drift analysis
In-depth understanding & extensive experiencing with Transformers, RAG, Vector DB and Large Language Models
Understanding of bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML
Proficiency in frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch
Solid programming skills in Python, with experience in pandas, numpy, and SQL
Solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts
Proven excellent leadership, problem-solving, and analytical thinking skills
Proven solid communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with business stakeholders and cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Big Data technologies (PySpark, Hadoop) and data streaming tools (Kafka, etc.)
Familiarity with the US Healthcare domain

Job Title: Lead Data Scientist, India - BCG X
Job Description:
Locations: Mumbai | Gurgaon
Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, exceptional collaborative spirit, excellent leadership and communication skills, a detail-oriented and can-do mindset, and robust understanding of business matters.







Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

OptumAI is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with deep subject matter expertise in text processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will be part of a team leading the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business.
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.
Primary Responsibilities:
Help design and develop the next generation of NLP, ML & AI products, and services for healthcare
Develop machine learning and deep learning models and systems in domains including, but not limited to: NLP, NLU, NLG, SLU and multidimensional time series forecasting among others
Ability to Quantize, Optimize GenAI models
Manage NLP & ML models lifecycle for a suite of products
Run large complex proof-of-concepts for the healthcare business
Manage prioritization and technology work for building NLP, ML & AI solutions
Lead the full end-to-end machine learning development process including data ingestion and preparation, feature engineering, analysis and modeling, model deployment, performance tracking and documentation
Establish best practices for end-to-end deep learning and machine learning development cycle to ensure rigor in process and quality in outcome
Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems
Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so
Required Qualifications:
Master’s in computer science, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or another quantitative field
7+ years of industry/academic experience in data science, machine learning or a related field
5+ years of experience with Machine Learning and Deep Learning modeling
3+ years of experience with Deep Learning Frameworks and Distributed training
2+ years of experience applying computational algorithms and statistical methods to both structured and unstructured data.
1+ years of experience in GenAI models
Exposure in RAG, LangChain, VectorDBs
Proven excellent communication, writing and presentation skills

Experience in the health care industry

Job Title: Research Intern –Data Science and Environmental/Agricultural Sciences
Job Description:
Company Description:
MacroCosmos Creations is a team of experts in diverse fields, committed to using scientific research and innovation to develop sustainable solutions for environmental sustainability, food systems, and health & wellness. Our team brings together experts from similar and diverse fields, including and not limited to forest ecology, biophysics, precision agriculture, and sustainable food and agri solutions to develop products and solutions that make a positive impact on the planet. Our values include ethical business practices, transparency, diversity, and inclusion, and we strive to ensure that our customers and partners understand the purpose and benefits of each of our products, designed to support a better future for all. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our team and contribute to our vision of creating a sustainable future for all.

About the Role:
We are looking for a Data Scientist that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data,
and help us make smarter decisions that brings in good business value.
Your primary focus will be in applying Data Mining techniques, doing Statistical Analysis, building Statistical /
ML models and support Analytic Implementations in production systems / processes.
Responsibilities:
Collect and analyze large sets of structured and unstructured data
Develop predictive models and algorithms to support business decisions - Selecting/engineering features,

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Associate Manager in Data Science to lead our team based in Bangalore. As an Associate Manager, you will play a critical role in driving the success of our Data Science projects, leading a team of data scientists, and delivering business needs. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, and a solid background in leading teams, interacting with business stakeholders, and delivering production-grade AI/ML projects. Candidate should have solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts and well-versed with bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML. Experience in the US Healthcare domain, knowledge of Big Data and data streaming technologies are is desirable.
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead a team of data scientists, providing mentorship, guidance, and technical expertise
Interact with business stakeholders to understand their AI/ML requirements and translate them into actionable projects
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project goals, scope, and deliverables
Utilize your expertise in Python, pandas, numpy, and SQL to develop AI/ML solutions
Apply frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch to build and deploy models
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), statistical analysis, and feature engineering to derive insights
Build, tune, and evaluate machine learning models for predictive and prescriptive analytics
Perform drift analysis and ensure the responsible use of AI/ML by considering bias and fairness testing
Oversee the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including data preparation, model development, tuning, and deployment
Ensure the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of AI/ML solutions in production environments
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML techniques and tools, and identify opportunities to apply them to enhance existing solutions
Document and communicate findings, methodologies, and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). 4+ years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, or a similar role
Experience in leading a team of data scientists
Hands-on experience in delivering production-grade AI/ML projects
Knowledge of the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including EDA, model development, tuning, and drift analysis
In-depth understanding & extensive experiencing with Transformers, RAG, Vector DB and Large Language Models
Understanding of bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML
Proficiency in frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch
Solid programming skills in Python, with experience in pandas, numpy, and SQL

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. Job Title: Research Intern –Data Science and Environmental/Agricultural Sciences
Job Description:
Company Description:
MacroCosmos Creations is a team of experts in diverse fields, committed to using scientific research and innovation to develop sustainable solutions for environmental sustainability, food systems, and health & wellness. Our team brings together experts from similar and diverse fields, including and not limited to forest ecology, biophysics, precision agriculture, and sustainable food and agri solutions to develop products and solutions that make a positive impact on the planet. Our values include ethical business practices, transparency, diversity, and inclusion, and we strive to ensure that our customers and partners understand the purpose and benefits of each of our products, designed to support a better future for all. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our team and contribute to our vision of creating a sustainable future for all.

About the Role:
We are looking for a Data Scientist that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data,
and help us make smarter decisions that brings in good business value.
Your primary focus will be in applying Data Mining techniques, doing Statistical Analysis, building Statistical /
ML models and support Analytic Implementations in production systems / processes.
Responsibilities:
Collect and analyze large sets of structured and unstructured data
Develop predictive models and algorithms to support business decisions - Selecting/engineering features,

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Associate Manager in Data Science to lead our team based in Bangalore. As an Associate Manager, you will play a critical role in driving the success of our Data Science projects, leading a team of data scientists, and delivering business needs. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, and a solid background in leading teams, interacting with business stakeholders, and delivering production-grade AI/ML projects. Candidate should have solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts and well-versed with bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML. Experience in the US Healthcare domain, knowledge of Big Data and data streaming technologies are is desirable.
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead a team of data scientists, providing mentorship, guidance, and technical expertise
Interact with business stakeholders to understand their AI/ML requirements and translate them into actionable projects
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project goals, scope, and deliverables
Utilize your expertise in Python, pandas, numpy, and SQL to develop AI/ML solutions
Apply frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch to build and deploy models
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), statistical analysis, and feature engineering to derive insights
Build, tune, and evaluate machine learning models for predictive and prescriptive analytics
Perform drift analysis and ensure the responsible use of AI/ML by considering bias and fairness testing
Oversee the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including data preparation, model development, tuning, and deployment
Ensure the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of AI/ML solutions in production environments
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML techniques and tools, and identify opportunities to apply them to enhance existing solutions
Document and communicate findings, methodologies, and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field
4+ years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, or a similar role
Experience in leading a team of data scientists
Hands-on experience in delivering production-grade AI/ML projects
Knowledge of the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including EDA, model development, tuning, and drift analysis
In-depth understanding & extensive experiencing with Transformers, RAG, Vector DB and Large Language Models
Understanding of bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML
Proficiency in frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch
Solid programming skills in Python, with experience in pandas, numpy, and SQL
Solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts
Proven excellent leadership, problem-solving, and analytical thinking skills
Proven solid communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with business stakeholders and cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications:

Familiarity with the US Healthcare domain

Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, exceptional collaborative spirit, excellent leadership and communication skills, a detail-oriented and can-do mindset, and robust understanding of business matters.







Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

OptumAI is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with deep subject matter expertise in text processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will be part of a team leading the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business.
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.

Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems

Job Title: Research Intern –Data Science and Environmental/Agricultural Sciences
Job Description:
Company Description:
MacroCosmos Creations is a team of experts in diverse fields, committed to using scientific research and innovation to develop sustainable solutions for environmental sustainability, food systems, and health & wellness. Our team brings together experts from similar and diverse fields, including and not limited to forest ecology, biophysics, precision agriculture, and sustainable food and agri solutions to develop products and solutions that make a positive impact on the planet. Our values include ethical business practices, transparency, diversity, and inclusion, and we strive to ensure that our customers and partners understand the purpose and benefits of each of our products, designed to support a better future for all. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our team and contribute to our vision of creating a sustainable future for all.

About the Role:
We are looking for a Data Scientist that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data,
and help us make smarter decisions that brings in good business value.
Your primary focus will be in applying Data Mining techniques, doing Statistical Analysis, building Statistical /
ML models and support Analytic Implementations in production systems / processes.
Responsibilities:
Collect and analyze large sets of structured and unstructured data
Develop predictive models and algorithms to support business decisions - Selecting/engineering features,

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Associate Manager in Data Science to lead our team based in Bangalore. As an Associate Manager, you will play a critical role in driving the success of our Data Science projects, leading a team of data scientists, and delivering business needs. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, and a solid background in leading teams, interacting with business stakeholders, and delivering production-grade AI/ML projects. Candidate should have solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts and well-versed with bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML. Experience in the US Healthcare domain, knowledge of Big Data and data streaming technologies are is desirable.
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead a team of data scientists, providing mentorship, guidance, and technical expertise
Interact with business stakeholders to understand their AI/ML requirements and translate them into actionable projects
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project goals, scope, and deliverables
Utilize your expertise in Python, pandas, numpy, and SQL to develop AI/ML solutions
Apply frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch to build and deploy models
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), statistical analysis, and feature engineering to derive insights
Build, tune, and evaluate machine learning models for predictive and prescriptive analytics
Perform drift analysis and ensure the responsible use of AI/ML by considering bias and fairness testing
Oversee the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including data preparation, model development, tuning, and deployment
Ensure the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of AI/ML solutions in production environments
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML techniques and tools, and identify opportunities to apply them to enhance existing solutions
Document and communicate findings, methodologies, and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Comply with the terms and conditions of the employment contract, company policies and procedures, and any and all directives (such as, but not limited to, transfer and/or re-assignment to different work locations, change in teams and/or work shifts, policies in regards to flexibility of work benefits and/or work environment, alternative work arrangements, and other decisions that may arise due to the changing business environment). The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so
Required Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field
4+ years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, or a similar role
Experience in leading a team of data scientists
Hands-on experience in delivering production-grade AI/ML projects
Knowledge of the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including EDA, model development, tuning, and drift analysis
In-depth understanding & extensive experiencing with Transformers, RAG, Vector DB and Large Language Models
Understanding of bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML
Proficiency in frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch
Solid programming skills in Python, with experience in pandas, numpy, and SQL
Solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts
Proven excellent leadership, problem-solving, and analytical thinking skills
Proven solid communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with business stakeholders and cross-functional teams
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with Big Data technologies (PySpark, Hadoop) and data streaming tools (Kafka, etc.)
Familiarity with the US Healthcare domain

Job Title: Lead Data Scientist, India - BCG X
Job Description:
Locations: Mumbai | Gurgaon
Who We Are
Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

WHAT YOU'LL DO

As part of the Digital product organization of BCG you will pioneer boundaries in technology and innovation. You will play a pivotal role in harnessing the power of data, analytics and data science to drive strategic decisions, fostering innovation, and providing powerful insights to steer the company towards success. Positioned at the heart of our global operations, you will be part of a dynamic team in the pursuit of analytical excellence, turning complex data into actionable insights that shape BCG’s future.

As a Global Data Scientist Senior Manager at BCG, you will play a crucial role in leading digital innovation and building analytical solutions and products that empower BCG leadership to make strategic, data-driven decisions. This role will be hosted in AI Center of Excellence and individual will be embedded within the Global Business Intelligence & Analytics team, you will collaborate closely with product owners and stakeholders to creatively solve BCG’s most challenging problems, bringing to life business-critical analytics at scale. The ideal candidate will have outstanding hands-on experience, exceptional collaborative spirit, excellent leadership and communication skills, a detail-oriented and can-do mindset, and robust understanding of business matters.







Our data analytics and artifical intelligence professionals mix deep domain expertise with advanced analytical methods and techniques to develop innovative solutions that help our clients tackle their most pressing issues. We design algorithms and build complex models out of large amounts of data.

OptumAI is looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer with deep subject matter expertise in text processing, NLU and SLU (Natural language understanding and Spoken Language Understanding) who will be part of a team leading the technical development and inventions that allow Optum machine learning products drive positive impact in the healthcare business.
Your expertise will bring business and industry context to science and technology decisions. As part of the OptumAI AI/ML engineering group, you set the standard for scientific excellence and make decisions that affect the way we build and integrate algorithms. Your code, designs and documents are exemplary and are used as references across the organization.
A successful candidate is a hands-on AI/ML engineering expert that will tackle intrinsically hard problems, acquiring expertise as needed. The candidate will help decompose complex problems into straightforward solutions.
Primary Responsibilities:
Help design and develop the next generation of NLP, ML & AI products, and services for healthcare
Develop machine learning and deep learning models and systems in domains including, but not limited to: NLP, NLU, NLG, SLU and multidimensional time series forecasting among others
Ability to Quantize, Optimize GenAI models
Manage NLP & ML models lifecycle for a suite of products
Run large complex proof-of-concepts for the healthcare business
Manage prioritization and technology work for building NLP, ML & AI solutions
Lead the full end-to-end machine learning development process including data ingestion and preparation, feature engineering, analysis and modeling, model deployment, performance tracking and documentation
Establish best practices for end-to-end deep learning and machine learning development cycle to ensure rigor in process and quality in outcome
Work with a great deal of autonomy to find solutions to complex problems

The Company may adopt, vary or rescind these policies and directives in its absolute discretion and without any limitation (implied or otherwise) on its ability to do so

Master’s in computer science, Statistics, Electrical Engineering, or another quantitative field
7+ years of industry/academic experience in data science, machine learning or a related field
5+ years of experience with Machine Learning and Deep Learning modeling
3+ years of experience with Deep Learning Frameworks and Distributed training
2+ years of experience applying computational algorithms and statistical methods to both structured and unstructured data.
1+ years of experience in GenAI models

Proven excellent communication, writing and presentation skills

Company Description:
MacroCosmos Creations is a team of experts in diverse fields, committed to using scientific research and innovation to develop sustainable solutions for environmental sustainability, food systems, and health & wellness. Our team brings together experts from similar and diverse fields, including and not limited to forest ecology, biophysics, precision agriculture, and sustainable food and agri solutions to develop products and solutions that make a positive impact on the planet. Our values include ethical business practices, transparency, diversity, and inclusion, and we strive to ensure that our customers and partners understand the purpose and benefits of each of our products, designed to support a better future for all. We are looking for motivated individuals to join our team and contribute to our vision of creating a sustainable future for all.

About the Role:
We are looking for a Data Scientist that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data,
and help us make smarter decisions that brings in good business value.

ML models and support Analytic Implementations in production systems / processes.

Collect and analyze large sets of structured and unstructured data
Develop predictive models and algorithms to support business decisions - Selecting/engineering features,

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Associate Manager in Data Science to lead our team based in Bangalore. As an Associate Manager, you will play a critical role in driving the success of our Data Science projects, leading a team of data scientists, and delivering business needs. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, and a solid background in leading teams, interacting with business stakeholders, and delivering production-grade AI/ML projects. Candidate should have solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts and well-versed with bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML. Experience in the US Healthcare domain, knowledge of Big Data and data streaming technologies are is desirable.
Primary Responsibilities:
Lead a team of data scientists, providing mentorship, guidance, and technical expertise
Interact with business stakeholders to understand their AI/ML requirements and translate them into actionable projects
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project goals, scope, and deliverables
Utilize your expertise in Python, pandas, numpy, and SQL to develop AI/ML solutions
Apply frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch to build and deploy models
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), statistical analysis, and feature engineering to derive insights
Build, tune, and evaluate machine learning models for predictive and prescriptive analytics
Perform drift analysis and ensure the responsible use of AI/ML by considering bias and fairness testing
Oversee the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including data preparation, model development, tuning, and deployment
Ensure the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of AI/ML solutions in production environments
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML techniques and tools, and identify opportunities to apply them to enhance existing solutions
Document and communicate findings, methodologies, and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders

Experience in leading a team of data scientists
Hands-on experience in delivering production-grade AI/ML projects
Knowledge of the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including EDA, model development, tuning, and drift analysis
In-depth understanding & extensive experiencing with Transformers, RAG, Vector DB and Large Language Models
Understanding of bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML

Company Description:
MacroCosmos Creations is a team of experts in diverse fields, committed to using scientific research and innovation to develop sustainable solutions for environmental sustainability, food systems, and health & wellness. We are looking for a Data Scientist that will help us discover the information hidden in vast amounts of data,
and help us make smarter decisions that brings in good business value.

ML models and support Analytic Implementations in production systems / processes.

Collect and analyze large sets of structured and unstructured data
Develop predictive models and algorithms to support business decisions - Selecting/engineering features,

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Associate Manager in Data Science to lead our team based in Bangalore. As an Associate Manager, you will play a critical role in driving the success of our Data Science projects, leading a team of data scientists, and delivering business needs. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, and a solid background in leading teams, interacting with business stakeholders, and delivering production-grade AI/ML projects. Candidate should have solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts and well-versed with bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML. Experience in the US Healthcare domain, knowledge of Big Data and data streaming technologies are is desirable.

Lead a team of data scientists, providing mentorship, guidance, and technical expertise

Apply frameworks such as Scikit Learn, TensorFlow, and PyTorch to build and deploy models
Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), statistical analysis, and feature engineering to derive insights
Build, tune, and evaluate machine learning models for predictive and prescriptive analytics

Oversee the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including data preparation, model development, tuning, and deployment
Ensure the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of AI/ML solutions in production environments
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML techniques and tools, and identify opportunities to apply them to enhance existing solutions
Document and communicate findings, methodologies, and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders

Knowledge of the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including EDA, model development, tuning, and drift analysis

Company Description:

ML models and support Analytic Implementations in production systems / processes.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Associate Manager in Data Science to lead our team based in Bangalore. As an Associate Manager, you will play a critical role in driving the success of our Data Science projects, leading a team of data scientists, and delivering business needs. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 8 years of experience in Data Science, AI/ML, and a solid background in leading teams, interacting with business stakeholders, and delivering production-grade AI/ML projects. Candidate should have solid understanding of mathematical and statistical concepts and well-versed with bias/fairness testing and responsible use of AI/ML. Experience in the US Healthcare domain, knowledge of Big Data and data streaming technologies are is desirable.

Lead a team of data scientists, providing mentorship, guidance, and technical expertise

Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA), statistical analysis, and feature engineering to derive insights

Oversee the full life cycle of AI/ML projects, including data preparation, model development, tuning, and deployment
Ensure the scalability, reliability, and efficiency of AI/ML solutions in production environments
Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI/ML techniques and tools, and identify opportunities to apply them to enhance existing solutions
Document and communicate findings, methodologies, and insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders
